children.subject: Thanks for your reply! Would you suggest me to take DS100 + EE127 instead of DS100 + CS189 to kinda focus on the fundamental material? I am required to take two tech courses each semester (and allowed choices are like above). I am not sure whether I am well prepared to Berkeley-level CS classes so I would like to start with lighter workload next semester.

yeah in that case DS100 + 127 in the fall would be a great combo!! That would allow you to take CS189 in the spring with Shewchuk (which in my biased opinion is a great professor). 

This is also a good plan because DS100 and EE127 are common prep courses to make sure you have the relevant background and mathematical maturity for 189. 

DS100 will be lighter than 127, and will give you a good ramp up to the intensity of 189 (says me about to submit a 189 hw that I have spent over 30 hours on ugh). 

The fall profs for 100 + 127 are great too!

You can read my perspective about 127 + 189 together this semester in @8893 but that is specific to Shewchuk's spring version of 189, can't say that applies to the fall profs version. 

I personally would have not wanted to add another tech (even though DS100 was light for me) just to focus on fundamental matieral. 

But also I am not a Berkeley CS grad student so you might just have the experience/skills  that assignments won't take you as long as they do me :)

history.content: Actually I am an incoming graduate student and will take the 200-level version of these classes, but it is still good to know which pair would be better in consideration of workload/difficulty.
history.subject: DS100+CS160/EE127/CS189
